pullRequest.body:
as part of the header linter. This yields better error spans, is more robust (as it avoids false positives from text-based parsing) and yields results more quickly (providing a better user experience).

Also rewrite the `broadImports` linter to log warnings directly, as opposed to passing them down to the `headerLinter` and logging them there.

---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.TextBased`|-1|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ duplicateImportsCheck`
`- duplicateImportsLinter`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Now that both these checks loop separately over all imports, maybe we can even unify them into a single loop that checks both broad and duplicate imports...  Sorry for not thinking about this earlier!

I see where you're coming from - but in the medium term, I view these linters as sufficiently different that combining them does not feel as helpful. For instance, after #14898 the two functions will have different signatures...
I'm puzzled by the test failure - I have no idea where the extra `warning` with line numbers is coming from. @damiano Do you have any ideas?
It looks like the warning about importing the `Tactic` folder is out-of-place.  Can you check?  I cannot get a working cache.
Indeed, the expected test output was out of order. It should be fixed now (I think; perhaps the test needs another adjustment later).
I just merged master. @adomani Let me know if you prefer me to split this PR in two, one for rewriting the `broadImports` linter to log warnings directly, and another for rewriting this linter.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.

Thanks!  Just a couple of minor wording suggestions.

maintainer merge
Thanks!  I'll take a closer look, but I can't right now!

Thanks!  Just a couple of minor wording suggestions.

maintainer merge

```suggestion
      output := output.push (mkAtomFrom i s!"Duplicate imports: {i} already imported")
```
I wonder if using this, you can `return` an `Array Syntax` and then use the `Syntax` as both the position and the message when you log it.
Good idea! I pushed a commit doing so.

Are you worried here that `getImportIds` will not return an `Array` of `.atom`s?  Also, I think that using `continue` (untested) *might* work better since it may not prevent the rest of the array to be parsed, even if one entry is not an `.atom`.
```suggestion
    let .atom _ errorMessage := out
     | continue
```

That is a reasonable point.
I am not worried about anything here: the point is merely that `out` only *returns** an `.atom`; the other case is simply unreachable. I've added a comment.

```suggestion
    Linter.logLint linter.style.header out out
```
Does this work?

```suggestion
      output := output.push (mkAtomFrom i s!"Duplicate imports: '{i}' already imported")
```
Just to make it clear what the literal import is.

```suggestion
def duplicateImportsCheck (imports : Array Syntax) : CommandElabM Unit := do
  let mut importsSoFar := #[]
  for i in imports do
    if importsSoFar.contains i then
      Linter.logLint linter.style.header i m!"Duplicate imports: '{i}' already imported"
    else importsSoFar := importsSoFar.push i
```
what do you think of making the function do the reporting, rather than accumulating an array and then looping over the array again later on?

A similar refactor could apply to the rest of the linter: when I wrote it, I was mostly concerned with not modifying existing code, but for the current format it probably makes more sense to emit warnings on the spot, rather than accumulating them and then logging them all again later.

```suggestion
          "'Mathlib.Tactic.Replace' defines a deprecated form of the 'replace' tactic; \
```
Feel free to ignore this suggestion, but I prefer the single quotes here!

```suggestion
          "'Mathlib.Tactic.Have' defines a deprecated form of the 'have' tactic; \
```
same here.

```suggestion
        make sure to benchmark it. If this is fine, feel free to silence this linter."
```
maybe?

pullRequest.title: feat: rewrite the duplicateImports linter
